relations.head: Interleukin-6
relations.tail: Signal transducer and activator of transcription 3
relations.label: activate
relations.text: Interleukin-6 (IL-6) induces either differentiation or growth of a variety of cells.

relations.head: Signal transducer and activator of transcription 3
relations.label: downregulate
relations.text: Blocking of Stat activation resulted in inhibition of IL-6-induced repression of c-myb and c-myc.

relations.head: Signal transducer and activator of transcription 3
relations.label: downregulate
relations.text: Blocking of Stat activation resulted in inhibition of IL-6-induced repression of c-myb and c-myc.

relations.head: Signal transducer and activator of transcription 3
relations.label: upregulate
relations.text: We show that dominant-negative forms of Stat3 inhibited both IL-6-induced growth arrest at G(0)/G1 and macrophage differentiation in the M1 transformants.

relations.head: Interleukin-6
relations.label: upregulate
relations.text: IL-6 enhanced the growth of M1 cells primarily through shortening the length of the G1 period when Stat3 was suppressed.

relations.head: Signal transducer and activator of transcription 3
relations.label: upregulate
relations.text: We show that dominant-negative forms of Stat3 inhibited both IL-6-induced growth arrest at G(0)/G1 and macrophage differentiation in the M1 transformants.

analysis:
Context:
• The study uses M1 leukemia cells, which are an immortalized cell line. There is no explicit in vivo disease model or pathological stress condition described. According to the strict rules, this is a standard immortalized cell culture context with no clear disease linkage.  
  ⇒ Context = none, Context Type = Undefined/Generic
